sen.j: 三条制札事件（さんじょうせいさつじけん）は、幕末の慶応2年9月12日 (旧暦)（1866年10月20日）。
sen.e: Sanjo-ohashi Bridge Noticeboard Incident occurred on October 20, 1866 in the end of Edo Period, in which Shinsengumi, a group that maintained public order in Kyoto attacked and captured eight retainers of Tosa clan who tried to pull out a noticeboard at Sanjo-ohashi Nishizume (the west foot of the Sanjo-ohashi bridge).

Sanjo-ohashi Bridge Noticeboard Incident occurred on October 20, 1866 during the the end of the Edo Period. The incident involved the Shinsengumi, a group that maintained public order in Kyoto, attacking and capturing eight retainers of the Tosa clan who tried to pull out a noticeboard at Sanjo-ohashi Nishizume (the west foot of the Sanjo-ohashi bridge).

sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理eight の前のスペース短縮新撰組の定訳を加え、a group を削除

sen.j: 当時京都の治安維持を行っていた新選組が、三条大橋西詰の制札を引き抜こうとした土佐藩8名を襲撃、捕縛した事件。
sen.e: The incident involved the Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate), that maintained public order in Kyoto, attacking and capturing eight retainers of the Tosa clan who tried to pull out a noticeboard at Sanjo-ohashi Nishizume (the west foot of the Sanjo-ohashi bridge).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外処理

sen.j: 1865年（慶応元年）に実施された幕長戦争の失敗以降、江戸幕府の権威は失墜し、慶応2年になると京都では幕府の立てた（長州藩を朝敵とする内容の）制札が引き抜かれるという事件が頻発しだした。
sen.e: After the failure in the Baku-cho War (war between bakufu and Choshu) executed in 1865, authority of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) collapsed, and in the following year, the noticeboards (that says Choshu clan is Emperor's enemy) put by the bakufu was frequently pulled out in Kyoto.

After their failure in the Baku-cho War (war between bakufu and Choshu) carried out in 1865, the authority of Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) collapsed, and in the following year, the noticeboards (that says Choshu clan is Emperor's enemy) placed by the bakufu were frequently pulled out in Kyoto.

sen.cmt: 慶応2年を 1867 に変更しました。

sen.j: 特に、鴨川 (淀川水系)にかかる三条大橋の西詰に立てられた制札が3度に渡って引き抜かれ鴨川に捨てられたことから、新選組に制札の警護が命じられれた。
sen.e: Especially, the noticeboard at the west foot of the Sanjo-ohashi bridge over Kamogawa river (Yodogawa river system) was pulled out and thrown into Kamogawa river three times, and Shinsengumi was ordered to guard the noticeboard.

Notably, the noticeboard at the west foot of the Sanjo-ohashi bridge over Kamogawa river (Yodogawa river system) was pulled out and thrown into Kamogawa river three times, and Shinsengumi was ordered to guard the noticeboard.

Notably, the noticeboard at the west foot of the Sanjo-ohashi bridge over Kamo-gawa river (Yodo-gawa river system) was pulled out and thrown into Kamo-gawa river three times, and Shinsengumi was ordered to guard the noticeboard.
sen.cmt: 川の名前の gawa の前にハイフン挿入

sen.j: 制札警護を命じられた新選組は、三条大橋を中心とした3拠点に隊士を配置し、いつでも包囲体制をとれるように準備を整えていた。
sen.e: Ordered to guard the noticeboard, Shinsengumi got ready to besiege criminals at any time by arranging the members at three points centered at Sanjo-ohashi bridge.
Ordered to guard the noticeboard, Shinsengumi were ready to arrest criminals at any time by arranging members at three points centered around Sanjo-ohashi bridge.
Ordered to guard the noticeboard, Shinsengumi were ready to surrender criminals at any time by arranging members at three points centered around Sanjo-ohashi bridge.
sen.cmt: 「包囲する」が besiege だと適切でないようですが、arrest だと後に出てくる文章でも不具合が出るので変更しました。ご確認願います。

sen.j: 事件当日は三条会所に原田左之助ら12名が、町屋に大石鍬次郎ら10名が、そして酒屋に新井忠雄ら12名が配置された上に、さらに斥候として浅野薫ら2名が配置されて不逞浪士の出現を待ち構えていた。
sen.e: On the day of the incident, 12 members including Sanosuke HARADA waited in Sanjo kaisho (a meeting place in Sanjo), 10 members including Kuwajiro OISHI waited in a merchant house, 12 members including Tadao ARAI waited in a liquor store, and two more members including Kaoru ASANO were arranged as patrols, waiting for appearance of repined masterless samurai.

sen.cmt: repine は不適切だと判断し削除しました。

sen.j: 新選組が警護に当たっていたところ、同年9月12日、藤崎吉五郎と宮川助五郎を中心とした土佐藩士8名が三条大橋西詰に出現、制札を引き抜く動きを見せた。
sen.e: While Shinsengumi was on guard, eight retainers of Tosa clan led by Kichigoro FUJISAKI and Sukegoro Miyagawa appeared at Sanjo-ohashi Nishizume and showed a move of pulling out the noticeboard on September 12 of the same year.

On September 12 of the same year, while Shinsengumi was on guard, eight retainers of Tosa clan led by Kichigoro FUJISAKI and Sukegoro Miyagawa appeared at Sanjo-ohashi Nishizume and moved as if to pull out the noticeboard.

sen.j: 土佐藩士出現の報を受け、原田左之助隊が現場に急行。
sen.e: In response to the report of the appearance of the Tosa retainers, the group of Sanosuke HARADA rushed to the scene.

sen.j: 逃走を開始した土佐藩士たちに、遅れて駆けつけた新井忠雄隊が追い討ちをかける形となり、新選組は有利に戦いを進めた。
sen.e: The group of Tadao ARAI that arrived later further attacked the Tosa retainers who started running away, and Shinsengumi was thus advantageous in the battle.
The group of Tadao ARAI arrived later and further attacked the Tosa retainers who started to run away, giving the advantage to Shinsengumi.

sen.j: ところが、斥候の浅野薫が乱戦を怖れたため、大石鍬次郎隊への連絡が遅れて当初予定していた包囲体制が完成せず、土佐藩士たちは退路を確保することができた。
sen.e: However, Kaoru ASANO, the patrol, was afraid of the battle, his report to the group of Kuwajiro OISHI was too late to besiege the Tosa retainers and they secured their escape route.
However, Kaoru ASANO, on patrol, was afraid of the battle, his report to the group of Kuwajiro OISHI was too late to mount an attack on the Tosa retainers who secured their escape route.

However, because Kaoru ASANO, on patrol, was afraid of the battle royal and his report to the group of Kuwajiro OISHI was too late, the plan to surrender the Tosa retainers failed and consequently they secured their escape route.
sen.cmt: battle→battle royal 「包囲」できなかったから退路を確保されてしまった、ということなので訂正しました。

sen.j: また、土佐藩士の殿を勤めた安藤鎌次の奮戦もあり、結局、新選組は8人の土佐藩士のうち5人を逃してしまうことになった。
sen.e: With a struggle by Kamaji ANDO, who fought as a rear guard of the Tosa retainers, Shinsengumi missed five out of the eight Tosa retainers at last.
Kamaji ANDO, who fought as a rear guard of the Tosa retainers put up a fight and Shinsengumi ended up losing five out of the eight Tosa retainers.

sen.j: この事件の後、浅野薫はその臆病な振る舞いを咎められて新選組を放逐された。
sen.e: After this incident, Kaoru ASANO was accused on his cowardly behavior and ejected from Shinsengumi.

sen.j: 参戦した隊士達には原田左之助の20両を筆頭に、会津藩から恩賞が与えられた。
sen.e: The members in the battle were given with reward grants from the Aizu Clan, such as Sanosuke HARADA given with twenty ryo (current unit).
The members in the battle were given reward grants from the Aizu Clan, including Sanosuke HARADA who was given twenty ryo (current unit).

sen.j: この事件は、新選組史上池田屋事件に次ぐ規模の大捕り物と言われることがある。
sen.e: This incident is sometimes referred to as the second largest capturing event after the Ikedaya Incident in the history of Shinsengumi.

sen.j: 余談だが、当時土佐藩士の間では長刀を差すことがちょっとした流行になっていたらしいのだが、この事件をきっかけに、長刀は使いにくいとの認識が土佐藩士の間に広まって流行が終焉した、との逸話が残っている。
sen.e: As an aside, there is a story that wearing a long swrod was in fashion among the Tosa retainers at the time, but the fashion was terminated as the Tosa retainers became concious of awkwardness to use the long sword triggered by this incident.
